title: Implicit +'static bounds on trait objects can cause cryptic error messages

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
Seen in revision acce46751ef985189fd0eeb3bf7c7dd577e69e74 of thepowersgang/rust_os, implicit +'static bounds can cause cryptic error messages, e.g. (this was caused by omitting a lifetime parameter from `impl ::async::Waiter`, which is completely unmentioned in the error.

```
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250:23: 250:60 error: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for autoref due to conflicting requirements
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250            let iter_bufs = dst.chunks_mut( block_step * block_size );
                                                            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:251:20: 251:45 note: first, the lifetime cannot outlive the method call at 251:19...
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:251            for (blk,dst) in iter_ids.zip( iter_bufs )
                                                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:251:34: 251:43 note: ...so that argument is valid for the call
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:251            for (blk,dst) in iter_ids.zip( iter_bufs )
                                                                       ^~~~~~~~~
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250:19: 250:22 note: but, the lifetime must be valid for the expression at 250:18...
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250            let iter_bufs = dst.chunks_mut( block_step * block_size );
                                                        ^~~
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250:19: 250:22 note: ...so that auto-reference is valid at the time of borrow
Core/metadevs/storage.rs:250            let iter_bufs = dst.chunks_mut( block_step * block_size );
                                                        ^~~
```

I will create a smaller reproduction of the error later this evening.
